column4: please help my ssh script does not works while on cron its ""ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub b@a.org"" it works without password when executed alone
it might be because cron runs without the usual enviroment variables that your user runs as
i gave the input file
what other environment is required?
cron dosent have a $HOME set, so ~ wont work
/home/username/.ssh is also not working :(
then perhaps ssh requires an interactive session
no, it is not interactive no password or a passphrase needs to be provided
exactly
what you mean by that?
i mean ssh most likely REQURES an interactive shell
and now how to prevent that
why not just put the real script into the crontab of the target computer?
actually i wanted to create a reverse port forwarding
ssh -i ~/.ssh/id -f -N -q -R 2222:localhost:22 my_name@remote.example.com is my script
that will never work in cron, you should be putting that in /etc/rc.local
i do not have root access to the system, is their any work around?
add it to your users startup scripts
like @restart in cron? u just said it wont work on cron right?
right it wont work in cron, add it to xsession or the startup applications
i can only ssh to the system from inside the lan
and?
i just wanted to ssh to that computer from outside the lan
